result.execSummary:
The defendant Montreal Marcell Porter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Montreal Marcell Porter is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Montreal Marcell Porter was found guilty of Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge and supervision fees as determined by DOC. To be paid during period of Extended Supervision on cases 2014CF4042 and 2014CF5413.  If not paid, a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentences.
*5/15/2015 credit amended to five (5) days.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised due to DV conviction under Federal Law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession  and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Montreal Marcell Porter

records.addlTxt: Copy of decision and order denying request for early release mailed to defendant.

DECISION AND ORDER DENYING REQUEST FOR EARLY RELEASE; signed, filed, and distributed. Clerk mailed copy to Defendant.
THEREFORE, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the Defendant's request for release to extended supervision is DENIED.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. David Feiss, Br. 46, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for release. (Montreal Porter #436857, FLCI, P.O. Box 200, Fox Lake, WI  53933-0200).

Amending Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed.
-- IT IS HEREBY ORDERED the judgment of conviction in 2014CF233 shall be amended to reflect a total of five days of sentence credit.  The judgment of conviction in 2014CF5413 shall be amended to reflect zero (0) days of credit on count one and zero (0) days of credit on count two.   mld

Defendant Montreal Marcell Porter in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Montreal Marcell Porter in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing Hearing continued from 6-11-2015.   Statements were made by the parties on 6-11-2015.    

AS TO COUNT #1: (as charged):  Defendant sentenced to serve 1 YEAR (CONSECUTIVE to any other sentences), with credit for 313 days time served.  

COURT ORDERS: 
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, 
  during period of extended supervision (on cases 2014CF4042 and 2014CF5413), or if not paid, a CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.   mld

Defendant Montreal Marcell Porter in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Montreal Marcell Porter in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds that the  State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Additional statements by:  John Winter and Ms. McNeil (parents).
Due to the lateness of the hour, Court ordered Sentencing Hearing continued to Branch 4 on 6-15-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
dated 5-28-2015, addressed to the court from defendant, received and filed.   mld

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson appeared via telephonics, defendant Montreal Marcell Porter not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Due to the unavailability of defense counsel, who is currenty in trial in another branch, Sentencing Hearing adjourned to Branch 4 on 6-11-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

signed and filed.
for Limited Reinstatement of Visitation, Telephonic and U.S. Mail Privileges.  
THE COURT ORDERES that the defendant shall be allowed to receive and send U.S. Mail while in custody in addition to making phone cals and having visits, provided that there is zero contact between defendant and Latasha H., (cases 2014CF233, 2014CF4042 and 2014CF5413).   mld

Defendant Montreal Marcell Porter in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Montreal Marcell Porter in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Upon the motion of the State, COUNT #2, dismissed on prosecutor's motion.   

AS TO CHARGE COUNT #1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Parties are not requesting a PSI report.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-16-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED pending sentencing.  

** COURT VACATES THE ORDER (issued 12-4-2014), that Rescinded Defendant's Telephone, Visitation, and U. S. Mail Custody Privileges.  The No Contact Order continues as to victim, Latasha H.  Proposed Order to be submitted by defense counsel.   mld
from defense, received and filed.   mld
from defense, received and filed.   mld
from defense, received and filed.   mld

Attorney Kristian Lindo in court for attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant, Montreal Marcell Porter, not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
State moves to adjourn the Jury Trial, currently scheduled for 1-26-2015, based on the new case (2014CF5413).  Demand for Speedy Trial was entered by defense on 10-29-2015 for cases (2014CF238 and 2014CF4042), and therefore, defense is opposed to State's Motion to Adjourn the Jury Trial.  For the reasons as stated on the record, Court finds cause to adjourn the Jury Trial and ordered CONSOLIDATION of cases; (2014CF233, 2014CF4042 and 2014CF5413), and Defendant's Right to Speedy Trial was extended from the date of 10-29-2015 to 12-15-2015.  Court vacates the Jury Trial date of 1-26-2015 at 8:30 am, and ordered case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 3-2-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Attorney Christon Lindo in court (via telephone) for attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Off the record.  Due to the unavailability of defense counsel (medical reasons), the Final Pretrial Conference is rescheduled from 1-15-2015 at 8:30 am to 1-22-2015 at 8:30 am.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 1-26-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
Motion to Admit Victim's Statement's Under the Forfeiture by Wrongdoing Doctrine filed by ADA Michael Thurston.

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, defendant Montreal Marcell Porter not in court, in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for final pre-trial, defense requests an adjournment.  Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Upon the request of defense counsel, who contacted the court by telephone, that due to medical reasons, Final Pretrial Conference rescheduled in Branch 4 to 12-22-2014 at 8:30 am.   Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 1-26-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, defendant Montreal Marcell Porter not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for Michael Schindhelm for the State of Wisconsin.
 Motion of the State to Join Cases 2014CF233 and 2014CF4042 is heard and granted by the Court.  Defense counsel does not contest the Joinder Motion of the State.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Discovery and offer for both cases, received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 12-18-2014 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 1-26-2015 at 8:30 am.  mld
Victim, Latasha H., appeared and requested modification of the no contact order.  Court denied modification of the no contact order.   mld

Defendant Montreal Marcell Porter in court with attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo for Jane Christopherson.  Defendant Montreal Marcell Porter in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Due to the unavailability of regular assigned defense counsel, case adjourned for hearing on State's Motion for Consolidation of cases; 2014CF233 and 2014CF4042.  Case adjourned for Motion Hearing in Branch 4 on 10-29-2014 at 8:30 am.     mld
CORRECTION as to Joinder issue in entry from 10/8/2014.

Defendant Montreal Marcell Porter in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Montreal Marcell Porter in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel substituted on pending case 14CF4042, court adjourned this case with pending case to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04 to address the issue of Joinder and if the lower pending matter should follow newly assigned Felony case.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
MOTION TO JOIN CASES: 14CF233 and 14CF4042.
turnover to Justice Point with ordered conditions.

Defendant Montreal Marcell Porter in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Montreal Marcell Porter in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion as to missed court date. Arguments as to bail. Court set bail in the amount of $2,500.00 CASH with turnover to Justice Point for Supervision with the conditions of ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY,  No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription, no weapons or firearms and comply with no contact order. Case NOT joined with 14CF4042 at this time.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on  09/09/2014 at 11:10 AM.
Bench warrant in file.  Case set for Return on Warrant/Status of Counsel date in branch 23 on 09/24/2014 at 1:30 pm.

Attorney Andrew J Golden in court.  Cynthia Davis for Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT in court. Court previously issued a bench warrant, defendant failing to turn himself into custody, court VACATED Jury Trial date of 6/23/2014. Bench Warrant Continued.

Attorney Andrew J Golden in court, defendant Montreal Marcell Porter not in court, in custody.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered bail forfeited pending restitution. Court did NOT vacate trial date.
Final pre-trial scheduled for 06-03-2014 at 01:30 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for 06-23-2014 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Montreal Marcell Porter in court with attorney Andrew J. Golden.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State is prepared to proceed to preliminary hearing.
Defense counsel informs Court that defendant wishes to waive the preliminary hearing.

Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Original Information, received and filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

Defense counsel requests adjournment for trial.  Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 23.  Court advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set.

Defendant Montreal Marcell Porter in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Defendant Montreal Marcell Porter in custody.  Francesco G Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
